description:
TATTIE SCONES - a Scottish fry-up essential!

My serving suggestion - Glasgow roll, square sausage, fried eggs, bacon, tartan sauce (HP Sauce + Heinz Ketchup). You’ll find yer Scottish accent may just get a wee bit thicker.

INGREDIENTS

500g peeled potato (dutch cream)
120g plain flour
60g unsalted butter
salt

-—————————————
METHOD

1. Cook yer tatties in salty boilin’ water until cooked.
2. Strain intae a colander and let them steam oot.
3. Pummel yer butter intae yer tatties and fold in the flour.
4. Roll oot between 1/2cm & 3/4cm thick and indent twa lines to give a 1/4 appearance.
5. Cook on a lightly greased pan an serve hot.

For those preferring English….

1. Cook your potatoes in salted boiling water until cooked through’
2. Strain and let them steam out in the colander
3. Mash your butter into the potatoes and fold in the flour
4. Roll out to between ½ and ¾ cm thick and indent two lines to give a 1/4 appearance
5. Cook on a lightly greased pan and serve hot!

description:
Spicy egg fried rice 🔥 Recipe 👇

INGREDIENTS:
5-6 green onions
6 cloves of garlic
1-2 tbsp crushed chilli flakes (add based on spice tolerance)
2 servings cold rice
2 eggs
Cooking oil as needed
—Sauce—
1 tbsp light/regular soy sauce
1 tbsp dark soy sauce
1 tbsp water
1 tsp sugar
Note: Add salt if needed

PROCESS:
1. Clean and trim 5-6 green onions. Mince the white parts and thinly slice the green parts for garnish
2. Mince 6 cloves of garlic. Add more or less depending on size of the cloves or taste
3. Take 2 servings of cold, day old rice in a bowl and separate the clumps. This helps in even stir frying. Cold, slightly dried out rice is essential for the perfect fried rice texture
4. Mix the sauce ingredients in a bowl and set aside
5. To a heated wok/pan add some oil and scramble 2 eggs with a pinch of salt. Set aside
6. Set flame to medium and add 2 tbsp neutral cooking oil. When the oil is hot, sauté the garlic and green onion for 30 seconds
7. Reduce flame to low and sauté 1-2 tbsp crushed red chilli flakes for 30 seconds or until fragrant. Chilli flakes will burn if the flame is too high
8. Increase flame to medium high, add rice and stir fry until mixed well with the aromatics
9. Add the prepared sauce and stir fry for 2-3 minutes. The rice needs to fry well so keep tossing and turning
10. When the rice is fried well, add the previously scrambled eggs. Mix everything well and adjust salt if needed
11. Add the green part of green onions and switch off the flame. You don’t want to overcook them
12. Serve the spicy egg fried rice with a crispy fried egg, a side of your choice or on its own

#easyrecipes #asmrcooking #recipes #friedrice

description:
Spicy egg fried rice 🔥 Recipe 👇

INGREDIENTS:
5-6 green onions
6 cloves of garlic
1-2 tbsp crushed chilli flakes (add based on spice tolerance)
2 servings cold rice
2 eggs
Cooking oil as needed
—Sauce—
1 tbsp light/regular soy sauce
1 tbsp dark soy sauce
1 tbsp water
1 tsp sugar
Note: Add salt if needed

PROCESS:
1. Clean and trim 5-6 green onions. Mince the white parts and thinly slice the green parts for garnish
2. Mince 6 cloves of garlic. Add more or less depending on size of the cloves or taste
3. Take 2 servings of cold, day old rice in a bowl and separate the clumps. This helps in even stir frying. Cold, slightly dried out rice is essential for the perfect fried rice texture
4. Mix the sauce ingredients in a bowl and set aside
5. To a heated wok/pan add some oil and scramble 2 eggs with a pinch of salt. Set aside
6. Set flame to medium and add 2 tbsp neutral cooking oil. When the oil is hot, sauté the garlic and green onion for 30 seconds

raw_transcript:
WEBVTT

00:00.000 --> 00:06.000
Since time immemorial, parents are looking for ways to sneak nutrition into the kids' favorite foods.

00:06.000 --> 00:12.000
Whether it is mixed with paratha, sneaky mac and cheese, blended soups or black beans in brownies.

00:12.000 --> 00:19.000
And as pancakes are in weekly rotation around here, I couldn't resist a chance to bulk up our breakfast routine.

00:19.000 --> 00:27.000
These zucchini banana, oat pancakes have a little bit of sweetness from the banana, and are moist and tender because of the grated zucchini.

00:27.000 --> 00:32.000
Thought flour used here can be made at home by grinding together rolled oats in the blender.

00:32.000 --> 00:35.000
And the whole dry mix can be made ahead of time.

00:35.000 --> 01:00.000
It has to be in tips in the caption.
description:
My new favourite hobby is adding veggies to every meal conceivable. I kid! Maybe not! We had already switched to almond and oat flour pancakes for breakfast. It seemed like the logical step to mix in some fruits and veggies to bulk the meal up even more. Zucchini, with its versatility and ability to blend into foods without causing much damage seemed like a good choice, although I could definitely see a mashed sweet potato, some spinach also doing well here. One could add all manners of veggies and a runnier batter would yield a nice crepe, or dosa for those whose tastes run more savory than sweet.
Oats zucchini banana pancakes
2 cups oat flour
1/4th cup almond flour
1 cup or more zucchini grated
1 banana mashed
1 egg
1 tbsp baking powder
1/4 tsp salt
1 tbsp sugar/jaggery
1 tbsp vanilla essence
1 tbsp cinnamon
Milk or water as required

Powder rolled oats in a blender to make oat flour. Add in the almond flour, and other dry ingredients. You can keep this dry mix in the fridge until you are ready to use. Grate a zucchini to yield about a cup, mash the banana into it. Add the egg, whisk, and add in the dry ingredients. Whisk and then add your liquid to it. Zucchini has some water so add in enough liquid to get a float batter, if it’s too thick, the pancake will remain uncooked in the middle. If it’s too thin, it won’t hold shape. The batter should flow, but not be too runny. Cook on both sides, this one won’t bubble like a traditional pancake and serve up warm.

#kidfriendlyfood #kidapproved #kidbreakfast #kidmeals #kidnutrition #healthybreakfasts #healthyfood #healthandflavor #healthylifestyle #glutenfree #glutenfreerecipes #vegetarian #vegetarianbreakfast #vegetarianrecipes #vegetarianbreakfastideas #vegetarianfood #foodie #food #foodblogger #hoboken #foodstagram #veggietales #explore #explorepage #explorereel #reelsvideo #reelsinstagram #tastemademedoit #theveggiefeed

description:
Masala Bengan Fry! SAVE IT!

Usually I would just make Begun Bhaja, marinate it with just salt, turmeric and fry it. But I was feeling kinda different. Felt like doing this extreme Masala fry. It was so good!

Ingredients
1 eggplant/brinjal/aubergine/bengun (whatever you call it)
1 tsp Turmeric powder
1 tsp chilli powder
1 tsp coriander powder
Salt to taste
2 tbs oil
1/4 cup Semolina/Rava
1/4 cup Rice flour
Pinch of chilli powder
Oil for frying

Follow me @bengaligirl.tries for recipes ❤️

.

#eggplant #eggplantfritters #friedeggplant #begunbhaja #masala #vegan #veganfood #veganrecipe

raw_transcript:
WEBVTT

00:00.000 --> 00:05.760
Valeshwar in Puna is known for its South Indian food, but for me it was always about the Parathabhaji.

00:05.760 --> 00:10.720
The simple Kormalak preparation of cauliflower and potato curry, served with hot parathas,

00:10.720 --> 00:16.240
was only available after 7pm. Maybe it was this elusive nature of the menu item,

00:16.240 --> 00:21.120
the fact that we would often go there ravenous after an hour of swimming, or because it was just quite

00:21.120 --> 00:26.640
simply delicious, but I would look forward to this Parathabhaji. This was the original location of

00:26.640 --> 00:31.360
Vladishwar, the less fancy one, the one with rickety chairs and cursory service,

00:31.360 --> 00:35.520
but the food more than made up for it. Punaikers might be familiar with the ratha,

00:35.520 --> 00:39.920
the brisk manner of service, jold out in restaurants and shops. Once had twice,

00:39.920 --> 00:44.160
we landed up at Vladishwar a few minutes earlier than the Parathabhaji service staff,

00:44.160 --> 00:50.240
and not only were we not served a minute before 7, we were also told off for asking for it before 7.

00:50.240 --> 01:00.240
Recibe in the caption.
description:
Before the new swanky Wadeshwar sprung up on FC road, the one in Sadashiv Peth was our go to. My aunt lives around the corner, and my swimming pool was close by. So we ended up at Wadheshwar quite often, stuffing ourselves with their pillowy Idlis and the special paratha bhaji. This bhaji truly forms one on my most treasured food memories in Pune. I remember the raindrops dripping down the umbrellas they had over the table, splashing on the metal tables, the smell of the sizzling dosa pan, the sights and sounds of Bajirao road, and the softness of the paratha dipped into the steaming bhaji. This recipe is an approximation of the above as I haven’t had that in ages, and there’s no recipe I can find.

1 onion
2 tomatoes
3 cloves of garlic
1 inch piece of ginger
2-3 green chilies
1 tsp cumin seeds
2-3 cloves
2 star anise
2-3 cardamom pods
Chop the onion, ginger garlic and sauté them in oil. When the onion turns translucent add the tomato and sauté a bit. Grind to a paste. Add the whole spices to more oil, and add the paste back.
1/2 cup yogurt
1 tbsp turmeric
1 tsp chili powder
1 tbsp coriander powder
1/2 cup dedicated coconut.
Mix it together, grind it and add it to the masala.
1/2 cup cauliflower
1-2 potatoes
Chop up the veggies and add potatoes to the masala and let it cook for 5 mins before adding cauliflower. Add water to avoid the paste burning. Cover and cook and garnish with cilantro before serving.

#punefoodmemories #punefood #maharastra #maharashtrianfood #punememories #foodblogger #indianfoodblogger #foodblog #foodie #indianfood #foodstagram #theveggiefeed #food #reels #explore #tastemade #explorereels #wadeshwar

description:
Grilled Chickpea Veggie Pitas (arayes inspired, but vegetarian and more stuffed) 🥙 - za’atar spiced chickpea filling, stuffed into some whole grain pitas then grilled till the outside is crispy. And, of course served with a dip because dipping things makes lunch way more fun.

🫑🧅 All together, this is a high protein, high fiber, and highly nutritious meal that will keep you satisfied.

Chickpea Pitas
2 tbsp avocado oil, divided
1, 15 oz can chickpeas, rinsed and drained
1/2 yellow onion, finely diced
1 red bell pepper, finely diced
4 oz of mushrooms, finely diced
5 cloves garlic, minced
1 tbsp tomato paste
1/2 tbsp soy sauce
2 tsp za’atar
1/2 tsp ground cumin
1/2 tsp ground coriander
1/4 tsp fennel seeds
1/4 cup parsley, minced
Salt and pepper to taste
3 whole grain pitas

Cilantro Garlic Yogurt Sauce
1/2 cup plain, unsweetened vegan Greek-style yogurt (I used @kitehill) or your favorite thick vegan yogurt
Juice of half a lemon
Salt and pepper to taste
1 clove garlic, crushed or finely grated
1/4 cup cilantro, finely minced
2 tsp extra virgin olive oil, optional

Place your chickpeas in a bowl and roughly mash them with a fork.

To a sauté pan over medium heat, heat up a tablespoon of oil then add in the onion, bell pepper and mushrooms. Give the mixture a quick toss and let it sit for 2-3 mins to release some of the moisture. Add a pinch of salt and sauté until the mixture has cooked down.

Add garlic and sauté until fragrant, then add the tomato paste, chickpeas, soy sauce and seasonings and sauté for an additional 2-3 mins. Stir in the parsley, taste and adjust seasoning to your liking and set aside.

Preheat a non-stick griddle then cut your pita in half and carefully stuff each pita half. Brush or spray the pita on all sides with the remaining oil. Place the pita filling side down on the grill for 3-4 minutes until grill marks appear then flip and sear it for about 3 minutes on the remaining sides. Repeat with remaining pitas.

For the yogurt sauce, combine the sauce ingredients in a bowl and whisk together then add salt and pepper to taste. Serve the pita with the sauce and enjoy.

#veganfood #cookingvideos #healthyrecipe #chickpeas #veganlunchideas

raw_transcript:
WEBVTT

00:00.000 --> 00:03.960
I learned how to make tiramisu from an Italian and unsurprisingly, I have been making it

00:03.960 --> 00:05.600
wrong my entire life.

00:05.600 --> 00:09.520
I always thought it had to be made with whipped cream to get that light and airy texture,

00:09.520 --> 00:11.480
but it's actually all in the eggs.

00:11.480 --> 00:15.440
To make it, you start by separating egg whites and egg yolks, and then add mascarpone

00:15.440 --> 00:19.080
and a bit of salt to the yolks, and mix until it's nice and creamy.

00:19.080 --> 00:22.840
Then beat your egg whites, gradually adding sugar until stiff peaks form, and fold the

00:22.840 --> 00:24.160
chew together.

00:24.160 --> 00:25.760
This is the cream mixture.

00:25.760 --> 00:29.440
Then you soak lady fingers in really good coffee and place them in an even layer at

00:29.440 --> 00:33.360
the bottom of the dish, spread out half the cream mixture on top, and repeat one more

00:33.360 --> 00:34.360
time.

00:34.360 --> 00:37.280
Let that chill for a few hours before dusting it with cocoa powder, and that's it.

00:37.280 --> 01:00.640
Don't forget to subscribe for more recipes below and I hope you try it.
description:
A very good, classic tiramisu 🤍 recipe below!

INGREDIENTS
3 large, fresh, pasteurized eggs, separated
500g mascarpone
1/2 tsp diamond crystal kosher salt
2/3 cup sugar
7oz ladyfingers
1 cup very good, strong coffee
1-2 Tbsp cocoa powder

METHOD
Add egg yolks, mascarpone, and salt to a medium bowl and mix to combine. This is easiest if the mascarpone is at room temp.

Beat egg whites in a large bowl with electric beaters or in the bowl of a stand mixer on medium-high. When the the whites begin to get frothy, gradually stream in the sugar. Continue mixing until stiff peaks form and the sugar has completely dissolved, about 3-5 minutes. Add yolk mixture to egg whites and fold until completely incorporated.

Dip each lady finger into the coffee and place in an even layer in the bottom of a 8.5x10.5 inch dish. Add 1/2 the mascarpone mixture over top and spread in an ever layer. Repeat one more time to use all the coffee, biscuits, and cream. Chill in the fridge for at least 3 hours, ideally overnight.

Dust with cocoa powder and serve.

*This recipe is adapted from a cooking class I took in Italy.

00:00.000 --> 00:02.160
Here is how you cook perfect rice.

00:02.160 --> 00:05.360
We're soaking rice for half an hour with the warm water.

00:05.360 --> 00:06.400
We only once.

00:06.400 --> 00:08.000
Next we're cooking rice.

00:08.000 --> 00:10.000
Just cook it with the hot water,

00:10.000 --> 00:12.160
a little bit of salt and a little bit of oil.

00:12.160 --> 00:14.480
On a high heat, 5 to 7 minutes.

00:14.480 --> 00:16.640
Only stir once.

00:16.640 --> 00:18.320
Don't stir too many times.

00:18.320 --> 00:19.600
You break the rice.

00:19.600 --> 00:21.120
Once the water gets reduced,

00:21.120 --> 00:22.960
you cover with the foil.

00:22.960 --> 00:23.840
Cover with the lid.

00:23.840 --> 00:26.720
Put it on low heat and leave it for 5 to 7 minutes.

00:26.720 --> 00:30.720
Put it rice every time.

description:
Want the secret to cooking perfect rice? 🍚Alright, Chef Minal will let you in on her secrets… just don’t tell anyone!

#Prashad #chefminal #cookingtips #cookingrice #kitchensecrets #howtocookrice #perfectrice #basmatirice #inthekitchen #cooking101 #rice #cookfromscratch #chefsofinstagram #foodietips #cheftips #feedfeedvegetarian

raw_transcript:
WEBVTT

00:00.000 --> 00:06.560
We, by Merck, from a neighborhood home dairy, and what I love most is that there's no

00:06.560 --> 00:12.960
cotton or plastic to dispose. It's boiled, cooled, and put into the fridge before we

00:12.960 --> 00:18.960
skim the cream. When the container gets full, it's ghee making day. A good whisk and there's

00:18.960 --> 00:24.960
a fresh butter. Give it a few rinses and drop in a dry chilli and a few grains of salt.

00:24.960 --> 00:30.560
A second round of frupping and that's a bunch of curry leaves. A ghee is ready to cool and

00:30.560 --> 00:37.360
strain. But wait, we're not quite done. The rest is used warm, drop in some cooked rice and a pinch

00:37.360 --> 00:47.920
of salt. That's our Nachati Sadham, a delicacy in every chutney at home.

description:
Ghee making day, is always looked forward to. The video and voiceover has it all for you. What's special, though, is that once the ghee is cooled and strained, we drop some cooked rice into the residue, add a pinch of salt and that's our "vennai chatti saadam" - a delicacy, which is fought over in every chettiar home..
